From: "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@...>

Lunarpine stomped through the snow barreling ahead clearing a path for the
clean up drones. Evory so often he'd stop, transform and check the scanner.
He was gaining ground on her but not fast enough. She was hurt bad and from
what he was told she'd only open the wounds even more by putting pressure on
it. He opened a comm, "Ice, it's Lunarpine You are endangering yourself and
possibly this entire planet." He hoped she could hear him but from what
Veratis had told him her link might have been affected by the virus. He had
to find her and fast. He sent a series of clean up drones ahead to see if
they could find her from the air. No effect was achieved. The scanners
reported various life forms around.

Veratis opened his comm trying to help with the search. "She's at the end of
scanner range. If she gets much further I won't be able to follow her." The
concern in his voice showed that he would not let this planet die because of
him. He'd never destroyed one of his creations before, He didn't want to
start now.
----- Original Message -----
From: <logomorph@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Friday, November 10, 2000 11:04 AM
Subject: WELCOME TO WILD KINGDOM!!


> Ice::
>
> She sniffed something on the wind. She lifted her head and looked
> around. Her shoulder was becoming extremly painful. She winced and
> layed her head back down. She was thinking about how Lunarpine had
> reacted to her. She was certain that he wasn't happy with her new
> form. She sighed and stood up. She smelled that scent again. She
> looked and saw a form coming towards her. She didn't think anything
> of it and kept walking. Leaving a puddle of blood in the snow where
> she had layed down at. Her bandaged was soaked and was falling off.
> She shrugged her shoulder and let out a pained roar. THe bandage fell
> to the ground and she sniffed it. It smelled aweful and acidy.
>
> She walked on, as the snow fell to the ground a little harder.
>
>
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> > ::Wolf::
> >
> > An organic arctic wolf made its way over the cold snow, sniffing
> for
> > food. It had seen an exchanged between two polar bears, but it was
> > not about to attack two of those huge things.
> >
> > The wolf stopped, looking at a white form laying on the snow. It
> was
> > one of the polarbears the wolf had seen earlier.
> >
> > Creeping closer, the wolf sniffed the air, the smell of blood very
> > prominent. Food....
> >
> > THe wolf creeps closer, trying not to make a sound.
> >
>
>
>
